text:
HI! I want to start a new validator node. Ihave everything setup like documented and I get this error when starting:
./start.sh -s "<https://sv.sv-2.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/>" -o "onboarding_secret" -p "blackmantacapital-primary-1" -m 2 -w
INFO: SCAN address not provided, deriving it from the sponsor SV address: <https://scan.sv-2.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/>
parse error: Invalid numeric literal at line 1, column 10

Do you know what the reason for this error could be? Where can I find log files?

Yes - that is fine (7/10 nodes whitelisted me)
Could it be a problem with docker compose? I have the older version "docker-compose" - but I changed the start.sh script to use "docker-compose" instead of "docker compose" - the error still is there

text: the parse error seems to come from the html parsing

elements.text: the parse error seems to come from the html parsing

text: YES! That was it - I included the slash at the end of the URL in the start.sh call and it was added by the script also

elements.text: YES! That was it - I included the slash at the end of the URL in the start.sh call and it was added by the script also

Hello,
We are setting up our new dev validator node today.  Can you please provide us a sponsor SV node to connect to from digitalasset ?
Our egress IP is 100.35.18.66.
Do we need to open any specific port in our firewall for any inbound connections ?
